Chapter.Title: Chapter 5-Urban Nightmare-‘The dream has been shattered; the tower has collapsed.’

Dialog.Content: L Corp, the White Nights and Dark Days, the Distortion, and the Library… With this, those four have been confirmed to be closely associated with each other.
It caught me off guard. Who could’ve expected the Library of all places to be a key factor of the White Nights and Dark Days.
And the Library’s location has finally been clearly determined.
It’s as if the Library is revealing more of itself the more dangerous it is considered.
The building shimmering like a mirage, in the midst of a fog shrouding the Nest of L Corp.
Those who tried to approach it got lost in the mist.
We should prepare ourselves soon enough.
Since that mirage is slowly becoming a reality as the fog is clearing up.
That means…
Yes. We received an official document.
As of today, The Library is designated as an Urban Nightmare by Hana Association HQ.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Think you’re getting closer?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To what?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The freedom you’ve been yearning for, I mean.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I don’t know. The one book is steadily on its way to completion, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Is that book really gonna resolve everything magically for you?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The Library quite literally holds infinite possibilities. Every possible combination of letters is written inside the books.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But mere fragments of those possibilities are worthless on their own.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: With the help of the invitation, I can navigate the countless possibilities and reach the ones I need for the one perfect book.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: As I weave the books and the Light following the invitation’s lead, I will complete the one absolute book.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I will create the book that contains all the answers I seek.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That… doesn’t sound impossible, theoretically…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m not just hanging onto theoretical possibilities.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I could learn a lot from seeing the various sides of the City in the process of creating the one book. This has its own meaning…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then I realize once again, that without the book there’s no way to find the answer from this City.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What do you mean, you can’t find the answer from the City?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I learned one thing from reading all the books of the inhabitants of this City thus far.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No one is truly free in the City. Every person is chained to something.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Not a single thing appears to be done out of free will; Fixers obey their Offices, and those Offices obey the Associations, even if they know full well that their orders might get them killed. The same goes for the Syndicates.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Everyone is heading somewhere, but no one knows where, and no one can decide where to go. They’re all drifting along with the flow.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I thought money could get you anything in the City, including freedom and whatever.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They could be free, but they aren’t. They actually seem to shun freedom.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They want to belong to something that isn’t themselves. They like to define themselves with the organization they belong to, or valuations made by others.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Their essence is so fragile, they can’t specify their own identity without encasing themselves in such a shell.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes, this must be what the “disease of the mind” was all about…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I was imprisoned underground and exploited for the freedom of the people of the City, after all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Taking away my freedom so that others can be free…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: To spread his enlightenment to the rest of the City…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Talking about your previous occupation, huh.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am. I actually want to crush everything to dust at this point… I want to ruin it all.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What about my freedom… Who will hold the responsibility for creating me and then carelessly leaving me to suffer?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I sometimes want to just forget everything… the Library, the one book, all of it…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Do you know how it feels to be denied since the very moment you were born? I do. I’m painfully aware.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Because that’s how my creator treated me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I would’ve loved for him to at least tell me what I did wrong.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All I could see of him was a pair of cold eyes without a single speck of expectation, and a quiet remark.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: A tiny whisper ordinary humans couldn’t have heard…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: “It’s only a machine…”

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can still remember that moment so vividly as if it happened seconds ago. I curse my memory.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I curse this body that hears words I don’t want to listen to. I curse this head that reminds me of things I don’t want to remember.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He sounds like a nasty person.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If he needed a machine to serve repetitive tasks, why did he bother breaking the Ethics Amendment to create you, with human emotions and everything?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I wasn’t exactly born with the capability to feel emotions. It slowly awakened inside me over monotonous repeats.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No, perhaps the truth is that he designed me so my emotions would awaken over time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Perhaps because the repetitive tasks… needed emotions.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He needed something that could form an independent response to slight variations in the ever-repeating script, all the while enduring eons of time…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Something he could keep in control so that it wouldn’t try to deviate from the script…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It wasn’t a humanlike machine that he needed. He needed a human with the properties of a machine.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’ll never know how many desperate struggles I made to stomach the cycle.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those being…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Closing my eyes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: All I could do in the endless stream of moments I didn’t want to see but had to witness was shut my eyes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That was the least and the most I could do to resist it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Real nasty. …But hey, that role you were forced to play did wrap up somehow.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You can think about what to do next now, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you telling me to just forget about the past and move on?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Try to be more attentive before you jabber nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can never forget. Keeping my eyes closed couldn’t protect me anymore… Even a moron would’ve been able to envision exactly what would happen and what kind of face everyone would make after so much time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Every second of that was inscribed into my memory, slowly and painfully.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can’t forget anything once I’ve seen it. I still remember everything so vividly.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s why I can’t forgive that man, he who left without tying up any loose ends with me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The man who created me on a whim and then let my life be crushed under the weight of time…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Nah, who am I to tell you to leave the past behind or anything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m just suggesting you think about your next move. It can provide a little bit of support for you at least, kinda like making a fence around yourself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s gonna serve as a floor to fall back on, in your neverending plot of vengeance.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I didn’t think you’d care that much for me.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s ultimately for myself, really.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Still, it seems evident that I am heading somewhere, seeing as my body is undergoing changes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: My mechanical exterior is turning to flesh, and blood has started to course through it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I still have a long way to go to reach the one book, though…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Could you actually be changing into a human?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That seems to be the case, although it’s not quite perfect yet.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Perhaps I could become a genuine human at the end of this journey.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: When I do, I could forget so many things so easily.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Free from the deluge of memories drowning me…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If I can let all the unwanted memories slide away, then I may think about what to do next like you said.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Shi Association - Southern Branch, Section 2

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director! How could this even be considered tolerable?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Suppress your feelings. And remind yourself; money, fame, and power rule over this world.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: He may be a Color, but that does not excuse the severity of a Fixer who doesn’t even belong to our Association setting us all up.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: He’s doing it so blatantly, too…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …So what? Are you gonna betray the Association, kill Branch Manager Thelma, and then kill the Blue Reverberation for our freedom?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I don’t see a way out of this… I heard even the Smiling Faces are involved…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: This is rotten to the core…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director, what has become of the core values of the Shi? The very identity of our association…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: If you want to overthrow the system, have patience.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: And sharpen your strength. There is nothing we can do in our current state.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: The director is right. We… can’t do anything about it right now…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Dammit… He’s leaving us with all these dangerous requests, knowing that we’re fatigued…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director Yujin will rise to become the president of Shi one day.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’ll be able to shake up this corrupted system once that time comes.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We are Section 2. Our role is to simply take care of the tasks given to us.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director… We’ve been dealing with Urban Nightmare-class cases for ten consecutive days.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Taking out the patriarch of the Naraku Clan, the retrieval of oblivion ingots, the destruction of the Fragment from Beyond, demolishing the Thin Beef Skirt Factory, and eliminating the captain of The Steel Comrades just yesterday.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We had to resolve all these requests in the last ten days, without even a break…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We normally shouldn’t be handling more than one such case per week…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Most Fixers of the Southern Branch’s Section 2 have already died.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And none of those who survived are in good enough condition to proceed with another request, including us.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’re on the brink of a breakdown, both physically and mentally…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’ve seen how Section 3 and its Associate Offices got wiped out in a wave of unreasonable requests, and the same is happening to us now…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: And most of all, your condition is looking worse than any of us, Director Yujin…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You stood at the front and fought more vehemently than anyone, to keep others from getting hurt…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Broken parts can be mended, and wounds can be sewn up.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Your injuries are simply too severe to be healed up in a day or two, director.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Everyone in Section 2 has suffered damage that would take much longer than a few days to recover, in fact. Unless we had K Corp’s Singularity or something…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: You worry too much. We’ll handle the Library request just like any other requests we’ve done so far.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director Yujin! Even if we were to handle this job successfully, they’ll still hand us yet more absurd cases!

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Valentin has a point. We might have to receive endless requests until Section 2 is annihilated and you are killed, director…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I do have plans. In the end, the root of this matter lies with the Blue Reverberation.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We aren’t heading to the Library simply to obey our superiors’ orders…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Our objective is to retrieve the books of the Musicians of Bremen.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: …They’re what we need to uncover the Blue Reverberation’s plots.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What do you mean…?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I received a tip off that the person who appeared to be the leader of a Syndicate named the Musicians of Bremen spoke with the Blue Reverberation some time ago.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are you suggesting that the books of the Musicians could contain information about the Blue Reverberation?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We will at least be able to find out what he is conspiring.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Then, the reason you sent Full-Stop Office to assassinate the Church of Gears was also…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: …I understand your intention. But acquiring that information isn’t going to be the end of it.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: What exactly are you planning to do?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I will take my own measures once this request is done.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Can we actually trust this, director? Can you promise us that you aren’t going to harm yourself for the sake of Section 2?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: You’ve always been so self-sacrificing, director…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: You can count on me. I know my own life matters.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: We can’t turn the tide if we’re dead.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Gather up the ones who can still move and fight. We don’t want to bring anyone who will only prove to be a burden there.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Understood.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She’s still honest to a fault.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you really sure you’re just a small, no-name Fixer?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even I can tell that your connections are simply too broad and deep for a mediocre Fixer at this point.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: To answer your question, yes, I’m only a Grade 9 Fixer.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s after I fell to rock bottom in a turn of events, though. I used to be a common Fixer, really.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is that so? What grade were you at before, then?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Would you believe me if I said I was a… kickass Grade 1 Fixer!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s honestly hard to believe, but… if you say so.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wow, that was a lot less distrust than I expected…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyway, I was just an ordinary Fixer who mostly collected intel. That’s why I got so many connections.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I can only put up a decent fight now thanks to the new body you gave me and the Library’s powers.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You said trust is important in this business, right? Is it okay to see an acquaintance of yours die like that?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s unfortunate to see ‘em struggle, yeah. Here’s the thing, though; we only saw things from their perspective.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You think they’re free from the blame of killing some other people who struggled for life and fought for change?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose not.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s how it is. Someone they killed must have been in circumstances as unfortunate as theirs.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, unless they weren’t. Point is, there’s no way for everyone to be equally happy. It’s a matter of perspective.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: So they opt to simply do their work without ever trying to get to know each other.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Everyone has their own stories.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But we can’t give up ours for the sake of someone else’s. Like what we’re doing.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s that, and this is this.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: We’ve done all the first aid we could give.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Director…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Focus on the work for now. We’ll take care of what we can first.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings. I am Yujin, Director of Shi’s Section 2. Introduce yourselves, everyone.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Huh? But…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: When someone greets us, it’s only polite for us to greet them back, isn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Yessir! I am Tenma, Associate Fixer in Section 2 of the Shi.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Fixer
Dialog.Content: Valentin, Associate Fixer in Section 2 of the Shi.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Section 2 Director
Dialog.Content: I came here through the invitation to acquire the books that are said to be here.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Then may you find your books in this place, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That was a memorable guest. She was different in many ways, but still left a similar impression like a Fixer I used to know.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You have a Fixer you used to know?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No… Have you heard of Kali?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Kali…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: She was nicknamed ‘The Red Mist’.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ohhhh, of course I do! She was the most distinct Fixer, even among the Colors. How’d you know her?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: She used to do all the cool stuff and then suddenly disappeared.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Let’s just say that she was a… former colleague of mine.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Red Mist was powerful. Really, that’s the only way to put it. Powerful.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And she only took requests for others, not herself. I thought, man, it surely is true that you can do whatever you want when you’re that strong.

Place.PlaceName: Location: WARP Train UW-212 - First Class Carriage

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Why hello there, passengers in first class seats.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: It takes twice the monthly wage of an average person in the Nest to afford a seat in this carriage, I hear?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: That means someone in the Backstreets would have to work hard for at least a year for it.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: I’ve always had some pressing questions about WARP trains.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: For example, what is the point of first class seats when the trip supposedly only lasts ten seconds?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: I guess it’s worth the expense, after all.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: You can sleep without a care in the world.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: All the while the passengers in the carriages behind us are defenseless against the maddening tide of time, trying to overcome it through the pain of tearing their own flesh or the comfort of conjoining with one other.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: I’ve always wondered what kind of outstanding technologies Singularities could be to transport people to any platform in only ten seconds, no matter how far it is.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: And now I get the gist of it after seeing how this train’s been going for about two thousand years.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Me? How am I staying sane, you ask?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Well, it’s all thanks to my fellow members of the ensemble. That hothead Elena and I’ve actually been here for only a week or so…

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Pluto says our consciousness can be preserved in stasis and unfrozen only when needed or whatever.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: He says it’s magic and all, and welp, I’ve got no choice but to trust him. He’s my coworker now, all things considered.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: In any case, I pity the fools taking this train.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Thousands of years of pain and suffering, and it’s all long gone from their memories when they arrive. They return to their ordinary lives like nothing ever happened after a status restoration procedure, isn’t that right?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: “Wow, WARP trains are awesome! It’s kinda expensive, but I can get anywhere in such a short time.”

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: “It’s a wonderful world. We can go everywhere in the blink of an eye!”

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Uttering such remarks, they’ll blend back into the City life, completely forgetting about the hellscape that took place on this train.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: The memories of trying to slaughter their own friends and families as all bonds were blurred over time, having lost themselves long ago…

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: And all of that is conveniently erased from their heads. It’s astonishing how Singularities are so uniformly appalling.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: And yet you rich folks are scared of even that, so you doze off in your safe space for those thousands of years.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: You must’ve heard a word of advice from some acquaintance of yours, hm?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: That you’d be much better off taking first class seats. Or some of you are already aware of the truth behind WARP trains, perhaps?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: That’d be ironic in its own right. You decided to take this train knowing what would happen.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Ah, in case a certain foolhardy individual or two are still believing that this train is broken or malfunctional:

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: It’s not defective. This train is operating as intended.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: You get the hint by now, don’t you? Strolling around in a completely different timespace axis for some thousand years, and when it comes back to reality…

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Tadaa~ It’s ten seconds later.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Taking long roundabouts through time, reduced to ten seconds in real life. Sounds like a perfect ride for people who are in a hurry, doesn’t it?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: What is your “real” life, though?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: The one you were living for some few decades, or the one you’ve been trapped in for thousands of years?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: If you lost your memories and returned to your ordinary life, would it be a blessing or a curse?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Who cares, really.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Moving on, my biggest question was this…

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: This box with T Corp’s logo on it, so shamelessly and ridiculously and nonchalantly on board.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: I was wondering what this thing was doing plugged into the train.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: But I could roughly guess why after a bit of thinking.

Dialog.Title: Nurse?
Dialog.Content: The hell are you doing, quietly muttering lectures to yourself?

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: You’re coarse with words as usual.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: I’m speaking to the couple of voyeurs who are probably watching us as we speak, of course.

Dialog.Title: Nurse?
Dialog.Content: Oh, right. That was the plan.

Dialog.Title: Nurse?
Dialog.Content: Being stuck in this train for a week really did take a toll on my focus.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Your acting was excellent. Were you an aspiring actress in the past?

Dialog.Title: Nurse?
Dialog.Content: Maybe?

Dialog.Title: Nurse?
Dialog.Content: Anyway, just carry on with what you’re doing.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: How cold.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: And it seems this disguise Pluto gave me has almost expired now.

Dialog.Title: Doctor?
Dialog.Content: Shall we get started, wealthy fellows?

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: I have no hard feelings for the somewhat average commoners back there, but you lot make me upset, if I’m being honest.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: The way you try to squirm your way into comfort with money like the maggots you are agitates me beyond reason.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: Life sure is bizarre, isn’t it.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: You spend your hard-earned cash for a first class ticket to keep yourself safe and sound from the torture of time… But now you’re about to suffer something entirely else.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: You unfortunately run into the likes of us and meet a terrible fate. Just because you’ve taken first class seats.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: Yeah, right. Who knows, one of you might have been a piss poor sod who just so happened to win a ticket, hm?

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: That’s what makes choices so mysterious and profound.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: I personally think there’s no such thing as choice in our lives.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: Someone is playing tricks on all of us, mischievously and sneakily.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: Staging an endless puppet show, attaching invisible strings to us.

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: Now, shall we get started?

Dialog.Title: Reverb. Ensemble Member
Dialog.Content: It’s time for a little puppetry.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So that’s the ‘Puppeteer’, huh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s as if he were speaking directly to us.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: If he’s part of the Blue Reverb’s gang, maybe he knows something about us.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Could the Blue Reverberation be focusing on the Library, then?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Possibly. I don’t know what he’s looking for, but it certainly ain’t gonna be normal.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What else could he be after, other than the books we have?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The question would be what kind of books they really want.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Anyway, WARP Corp. is going to be in big trouble if the disappearance of every passenger in the first class carriage gets known by others.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: For sure. W Corp. might get involved with us at this rate.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Was this part of the Blue Reverb’s plan…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It would be intriguing if that were the case.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, I bet your enthusiasm will turn into disdain real quick when you actually meet that cuckoo.

Dialog.Title: Puppet
Dialog.Content: Gigigigi.

Dialog.Title: Puppet
Dialog.Content: Grgrgrgrg.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Guests who cannot speak…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Still, you’ve managed to come to the Library through the invitation… That means you must have some sort of consciousness, no?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even though you are puppets controlled by the strings above you.

Dialog.Title: Puppet
Dialog.Content: Gygygygygyg.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I have no idea what you may be saying.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you want to get the books as your puppeteer so wishes, you can go through that door.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those puppets were conscious somehow, right?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They appeared so. We could resolve books from them, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Although they didn’t have control over their bodies, they still seemed to carry minds of their own.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And they had to witness their own bodies being tugged along by strings while their senses and feelings were intact.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Does that mean…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Yes. The Puppeteer is a Distortion.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And those puppets were its byproducts.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’ve seen several Abnormalities that could create underlings for themselves, so I can understand this to be a similar case.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Poor folks, working their asses off only to be treated like dolls.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I could understand their feelings well.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: After all, I used to be a puppet myself.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Can those puppets be freed, though?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Killing the Puppeteer may free them from the attached strings, but they would remain ragged dolls.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I must wonder if they’d still want to live in that form?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yeah, fair enough. Knew it couldn’t be that simple.
…you enjoy today’s show?
Laugh to your heart’s content at the end of a weary life, and maybe you could have a good eternity’s sleep!
You never know, regular viewers of ours might get the chance to come on our stage in person!
It would be so delightful to join me on this stage, wouldn’t it?!
We’ll be back at the same time tomorrow to bring you even more laughter.
Nail your heads, everyone, and have a bloomy splodey night~!

Place.PlaceName: Location: Deep in a Mountain Trail

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Still bothered by what your boss said?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: How could I not be? I’m sick of nitpicks like that already…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Can’t help it. We did make an error…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Think about it, though. Of all the screens, it had to be the one in the farthest corner… And it happened in the darkest nook-cranny at the edge!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: We can’t possibly check them all with just a measly pair of eyes…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: And that’s why you asked me to go for a walk all the way out here?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Well, I needed to clear my thoughts. And you’re the only other smoker in our department.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Aaaand, we’re lost in the woods now?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …You didn’t have to point that out.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: You can beat around the bush all you want, but you can’t hide anything from a friend of five years, no?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Let’s peep at this in a positive light. We’ll find a way if we keep walking. Besides, it’s been a while since we were in a nice, open area like this.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: We’re surrounded by trees, though…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Now remind me again whose fault is it that we got lost?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …Yeah, sorry.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: What the hell? I swear I was following the footpath right… And I don’t see anything like a trail anymore.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: It’s nighttime. Maybe you got in the wrong direction ‘cause of the dark.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Oh, whatever! Regular maintenance is ending in an hour… We’re not gonna be back in time at this rate.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: What’s the worst that could happen, getting fired?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Don’t say vicious stuff like that even as a joke! You won’t have to worry about money even if you catch the pink slip, Emma, but I’m not you.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: You know what, nevermind… You saw how furious the chief got, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: If they were that mad, then they might be preparing documents to fire me already. Or worse, my post could be long gone by the time I get back there…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: You can always ask me for help, remember? I told you I can help you reach your dreams.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: There are things you’re much better at than staring at boring screens all day. Something you have the talent for!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Yeah, yeah~ You’re moving me to tears, buddy o’ pal o’ mine, but I’m not interested in being a doll for the rich to play with~

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: And I scrapped my dreams ages ag— …Hey! What’s up, stopping like a car before a deer… That’s dangerous, man.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Hey Noah, doesn’t that thing over there… look like a tent?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: What? …Huh, it really does. Did someone set up a camp or something?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: There might be someone living in there. Let’s check it out.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: I’m nervous… You sure you wanna go there?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Who knows? They might be kind enough to tell us a way outta here.

Place.PlaceName: Location: Entrance to a Big Top

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …Whoa, this place is huge. It’s a bit dilapidated, but… It’s much more fascinating close up?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: I think I saw something like this in a book… What did they call it… A circ—

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh my, could you be our new guests? The show just ended, though.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …GAH!! What the… Who the hell are you!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Oh, are you the owner of this place? We apologize… We dropped by to see if there’d be someone here to give us directions.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh, that sure sounds like a troubly-trouble… There’s no need to be sorry, no.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: This is the 8 o’Clock Circus, giving smiles to the smelly City dwellers!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Let’s skip introductions. My name doesn’t matter too much, does it?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: We’re long past the archaic era of introducing each other with names and everything~

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Shall we sniff each other’s wrists instead?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: No thanks…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Emma, this place is weirding me out. Let’s just skidaddle now…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh dearie me! Was I too scary for you!?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Hold your worries! I’m but a clown who wishes to rub lemons on everyone’s tongue!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: And that one over there… seems curious about our circus!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Wow… Check this out, Noah. It’s dark, but I see lots of neat things here.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Giant balls, different kinds of instruments… There’s a lion and an elephant, too! And also…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …It’s real. I’ve never seen an actual circus before.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: The book said circuses like this passed into history long ago…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Care to learn more about us? If you want, I can give you a nice special! A once-in-a-lifetime field trip.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I’ve been feeling so stale, too!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …He keeps talking nonsense.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Noah… It’s too dark to find a path, so we might as well…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Sigh… Whatever. I’m doomed to get fired anyway, so you take care of my future.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Haha, you’re such a joker.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: What a lovely friendship to behold! Come on in, then.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh, and watch your feet now~ Hungry flowers might bite you!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Flowers can bite…?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: This fella is Mr. Lion. He’s the strongest pal here!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: He may seem cold and sharp, but on the inside, he’s actually soft and warm like a fur coat. He’s not a bad lion!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: People have left a good amount of 5-star reviews about Mr. Lion’s belly, you see~?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Hmm… This lion’s teeth are oddly round and blunt.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: What are you on about, Noah? They’re so sharp, it could hurt you if you touched it… Are you too tired right now?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: …Maybe I mistook them for something else in the dark. I don’t really… wanna get into its belly, though…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: And this is Mr. Elephant! He makes the loudest noise in the circus.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: For realsies… He loves to sing so much all the time, we had to give him a candy to keep him quiet!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I don’t want anyone reporting us for noise pollution!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: This is in the middle of nowhere, I don’t think there’s anyone who—

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Don’t be a silly moose! Mrs. Ant would be sad to hear that. We have a massive ant nest beneath us.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: And we also have Ms. Mermaid, Ms. Hexagonal Cone Hat, Mr. Knife, and many, many others!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Ms. Mermaid joined us because she was sooo scared of the sea. She’s very glad to be on land now!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: That’s strange, I thought mermaids are usually supposed to live in the oceans or underwater…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Harumph, this is why I don’t deal with people who have cold rice for brains!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: We’re talking about basic knowledge here. The uppitymost very basics. Don’t you know that living in the sea makes you fish food?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: I mean, mermaids are fish too…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Bonkers!!!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Fish eat fish all the time!!!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: …Phew, getting so worked up is out of character for me! Where was I?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Wow, Mister Lemon Clown, these are the coolest circus crew I’ve ever seen!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: They’re… special. I feel like something about them speaks to my heart.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Don’t tell me you actually like this screwy tent. I’m not taking that crap.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Don’t be so sour, Noah. It’s such a wonderful place, can’t you see?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: And they can make people smile through tough times like this. A circus… I wanna see it, too.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Forget it. This is just insane… You can stay here if you want, I’m leaving.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: But this is a rare chance…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Ah, you want to join us?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Pardon? Um… No, actually… I just wanted to watch your show.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Aw, that’s a big shame… Everyone couldn’t understand my words and actions and left me, one by one.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: My secret pals were the only ones who stayed with me ‘til the end!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: The mermaid who snacks on jelly beans inside seashells… The hamster who’s so tall, he can drink clouds off the sky…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Oh dear…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: My earnest efforts to bring merry smiles to people were adored by Ms. Sun, who then whispered to me that she will make my wish come true.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: It was the outrageous, head-blowing wish to frolic with my secret pals!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: So I am now living the dream of my life, joyfully performing at the circus with my friends every night.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Joy… Dreams…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: It’s rather obvious that you’d be attracted to us! I do understand your feeling, oh I do.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Can I really be happy… if I joined your circus?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: You don’t say! Every moment of your life will be filled to the brim with the thrilling taste of pepper!

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: I’m gonna be fired from J Corp. for my mistake anyway… I don’t wanna go back to the Backstreets, either…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Even if I got to keep my job, I don’t want to set foot in that living hell again.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: I… I just wanted to watch the world and the skies from a higher place.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: I know that my dream was an empty one… I knew there was no way I could achieve it as long as I was at the bottom.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: And when I finally scratched and clawed my way up… I just stare at boring screens until I get fired.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Noah… If there’s anything I can help you with…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: What? Hahaha… You’re still making a mockery of me…

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: It’s always money, money, money. You say you can solve my problems with money; do you think everything will work out by simply throwing money?

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Why did you even follow me into that shitty department in the first place? You could live fine without it.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: No, you know what, just… Just forget it all.

Dialog.Title: Corporate Drone
Dialog.Content: Hey, the clown over there. I wanna be a part of your crew.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh, yikes and a half… The mood doesn’t seem so bright here!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: You can’t join us if you’re hanging out with those meanie tears, y’know?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Aha! I’ll help you say goodbye to those mean friends flowing down your cheek. We’ll be friends with each other when you open your eyes!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Now then, let’s…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: …Ah, so you’re finally awake! You were asleep for so long, I was almost starting to worry if I’d have to place a well-cooked drumstick on your nose!

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: The world’s… My eyes… There’s too many worlds. What the hell. It’s making my head spin…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: No worries. You’ll get used to it soon enough!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: A present for an observant and curious friend, who wanted to witness the variety of the world from a higher place!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I gave you eyes that can glance at everything, from ants on the floor to spiders on the ceiling. Consider this a welcoming gift from us!

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Wha… What does that even… Emma… Where’s Emma!

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: It’s okay, Noah. Although I can’t see where you are, I’ve been next to you the whole time.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: I could finally help you as who I am, not in the form of material wealth!

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: You were right. I lived a sheltered life, so I don’t know much.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: The scenery I saw would simply pass by.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: I’ll lift you up. You’ll be able to see more things from the new heights.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I’m glad that you seem to like our gifts!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I have one favor to ask of you two, however.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: What’s that?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Actually… Bad guys came into our circus tent some time ago and swallowed my friends whole!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Poor Ms. Hippo and Mr. Ball… I was so saddened that day, my frown was as long as three sausages…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: And my big and magnificent palace was ruined thanks to them.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: That’s awful. Who were the culprits?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: It doesn’t matter who they were. All I know… is that they later went to a place called the Library!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Our splendid circus had never failed once, but for some reason, we couldn’t move their hearts…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I want to know! WHHHHY!!!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: …Oh no no no, whew! I’m wondering how they didn’t pop their flowers despite my cute tricks and acts.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: If we can read their books… Then I could hold a circus that’s so entertaining, even people like them will shake their salts, don’t you think?

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: …It feels uncertain, but if the way is written in their books, we’ll be able to hold an even grander circus.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Is it really okay to enter that place, though…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh, how compassionate of you! I knew I could count on you two. Sniffle, sniffle…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: If you manage to return, we should throw a party to celebrate it!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: We’ll feast on otherworldly delicacies like the sea cocktail garnished with a piece of a cloud, and lion’s mane chili fries!

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Sounds promising. What do you say, Emma… Shall we go?

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: If that’s what you want.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Phew, now I have a lot to prepare!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: First off, for the duo… I should prepare a hefty feast that’ll make their teeth groan!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: I need to recruit more members for my circus… Practice with Ms. Mermaid’s scale mane, and then…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh my! Who is this rude intruder!?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Where am I…?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I was… fighting inside the Library…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: …Hahaha! Are you perhaps a new clown? Or are you simply here to watch our show?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: No, I…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: It’s good either way! Holding a teensy little performance for our jesting visitor should be as easy as chewing cold pie-flavored gum.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: This is… the 8 o’Clock Circus!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: We bring the bestest of the smells to City people who have lost their flower stalks.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: What…? The 8 o’Clock… Circus?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hunh, I was wondering where Philip got sent with Oscar’s device… And he had to be dropped there of all places…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I’m curious about what that nutjob of a clown is up to next. The Invitation cuts things off at odd timings, it could’ve shown us just a bit more…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: He’s not today’s guest, so it doesn’t matter much, does it? And the Invitation simply shows us what we need to see, so don’t complain about it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …Fair enough.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Putting that aside, a tall guy and a guy with four eyes, literally… Both look fancy, but neither seems normal.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: One who needs help from another person to stand high… I’m not sure I understand.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, you don’t have much choice unless you’re born to a rich family, you know?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Being a gifted child won’t matter if you don’t have the money to support that gift.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you trying to say that hard work alone cannot earn recognition?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s usually the case for people who aren’t blessed with pure fortune.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If what you said is correct, having more money would lead to happiness. But the man we saw was angry about the idea, rather than being happy. Why is that?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It differs from person to person. Could be his last bit of pride, could be the fear of earning the reputation of a greedy man who only makes friends for their wealth… On top of that, it kind of hurts, too.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: As delightful as it is to have someone who can gladly give you money to help… It can make you feel upset and slighted at the same time.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Upset about what?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: About how you had to give up everything you dreamed for because you weren’t wealthy enough, and your friend is readily able to give away the money you needed like it’s chump change to them.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And you’re basically dragging that rich friend into your messy life by getting financial help from them, wouldn’t that be morally distressing?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Maybe the friend simply wanted to help, but didn’t know the best way to go about it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whatever the case. It’s about how the receiver takes it, regardless of the intention.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I see.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Going back to our guests who willingly joined the freak show… I guess they were that desperate to achieve their dreams, huh?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This world surely is big enough to fit in all kinds of weird freaks… I can understand wanting to have a refuge from reality somewhat.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Even then, thinking about what kind of hideous body might be hiding under that beautiful clothing… Geh, it’s making me retch.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Curb your unnecessary curiosity. You should focus on the reception for now.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Am I on the right track? Are we still far from the Library…

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: No, it’s right ahead of us. Take slow steps just in case.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: For a place that’s supposedly full of monsters… It’s actually rather quiet and clean.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: I think this place is big and fancy… though not as much as our circus. My head isn’t bumping on any ceilings.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I am Angela, the director and librarian of my role’s namesake.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Hello!!! Can you hear my voice~!!!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Yes, I can hear you loud and clear. There is no need to shout at the top of your lungs.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: She’s right below us, buddy o’ pal. And think of me who has to hear your voice up close.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Heh heh, sorry. I thought people down under wouldn’t hear me well since I’m so tall.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: Angela! If we manage to get all the books we need… I’ll invite you to our next performance!

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: I’m sure those books contain the secret to making more people happy…

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: With that, we’ll be able to turn your cold stare into a hearty smile.

Dialog.Title: Circus Trouper
Dialog.Content: We promise to bring you happiness, so please!! Look forward to it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …Yes. I appreciate your sentiment.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you… find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I honestly thought the tall guy might break the Library’s entrance for a moment.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Anyways, about the man who turned those two people into freaks…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You think he has something to do with the Blue Reverb’s gang of “musicians”?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s too early to make such a conclusion.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: His purpose of sending people here seemed different from that of the Blue Reverberation and those related to him.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: However, there’s something about him that differentiates him from ordinary humans. He could be a being of similar essence to the Blue Reverberation’s accomplices in some ways…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Neither of them look normal, that I can say for sure.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I knew it. It’s pretty much impossible to understand the language of Sweepers without an interpreter to translate ‘em for you.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Wait. I can promptly translate their speech as long as it has the form of a language.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Wha, seriously? You can make sense out of those few sentences AND decode a whole language from them?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’m that capable.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: It is becoming clear that the night is no longer ours alone.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I know. I know that we have fewer and fewer places to properly dine at with our families.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I hear that the families who dine at the Nest of L Corp. are recently having a hard time seeing what is in front of them because of the mist covering the area.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I hear that some families even get lost in the fog and fail to leave.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Why… are we not… letting Mother know…

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: If Mother knows, she will wage an all-out war against the Index. We are not certain enough to risk losing our families to battle.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: If it is true that the Index truly has betrayed us, and if Mother is too late to realize their treachery… Many of our families will starve. They will slowly die out.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Less food… means Mother… will have… difficulty… fostering… new family members…

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: We all have our own homes, our own families, and our own children.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I am not advocating neglect. I am simply saying that we need to practice caution.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: You know that it has only been a week since those despicable filth known as the Carnival raided the dens of our brothers and ate our families.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Five days ago, L’heure du Loup invaded my younger sibling’s den and brutally killed two families.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Three days ago, a Proxy of the Index laid waste on our neighbors.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Two days ago, Puppeteer took my children. And yest—

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I know! I know that those incidents all happened at night!

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I know that our presence is not as powerful as before! I know that we have lost our dominance over the nighttime of this Nest.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Mother should be aware as well. We know that we need more space to use as our den.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Then… why…

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: We will only lose more of our dens if we get involved in bigger conflicts. If we were to engage in a full-fledged battle against the Index, we will have even less time in our hands. We must make it through, on our own.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: What will we possibly do.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: It is the Library. We must go to the Library.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I know that the Library has the books of those who worked for the Thumb and the Index.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Have you received its invitation?

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I have. With this, we can confirm if the Index truly has turned its back on Mother and our families.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Moreover, this will help us relieve the hardships of our families dining at Nest L.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: If we… are not… too late… by then… that is…

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I understand what you mean, uncle.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Let us call our neighbors. Let us head to the Library together.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Let us tell our children to lock the doors and not let strangers in before we leave.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Let us as parents protect our Mother, our neighbors, our family, and our children with our own hands.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Whoa… Are we really getting Sweepers as guests here?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They have the capacity to collectively go somewhere with a clear purpose at a time that isn’t night? And talk so fluently?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: That’s funny. I expected them to be a little coarser.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I once got an interpreter to try to talk to ‘em before. I thought they could only speak in jumbled words back then.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But boy oh boy, look at them using complete sentences. And they’re so talkative with each other, too…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That means the interpreter I paid an arm and a leg for was a total scam and a rip-off.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are the Sweepers all composed of family members?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s probably just a symbolic term they chose to forge bonds between each other. I doubt they’re actually families by blood. It’s metaphorical like the titles most other Syndicates use.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I heard they kidnap children from the Outskirts and the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I don’t really suggest looking too deep into Sweepers. They’re all over the Backstreets and the Outskirts. And I don’t think they have much to do with the freedom you’re looking for, anyway.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Dear neighbors, this is the Library.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: This is the place the scum of the Backstreets have been rattling on about.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: We… did not… expect… to come… to the Library ourselves…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Greetings. …Are you our family?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There’s no way I am, now is there?

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: However… you speak… in the language… of our family…

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: We can speak with other members of our family.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I try to talk to the guests on their level these days, as you can see.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I am impressed. This is surprising. Behold, neighbors. The Library is not like any other place.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: I know. This is the first time we are having a real conversation with someone who is not our family.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Family, family, family, family… Could you stop with that horrid rubbish?

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: Family… is important… It is not… horrid…

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: We apologize. We are simply here to take the books we desire.

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: And in regards to the mist covering this Nest… Do you know anything about it?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’ll find out when you read the books, no?

Dialog.Title: Sweeper
Dialog.Content: That is true. All we want is to acquire the books we want to find. We will be satisfied.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Fine. May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Boy, was that exhausting. Those Sweepers sure are persistent.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: What kind of deal could’ve made them so desperate, I wonder.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The most I can tell is that the Sweepers are losing their ground, so they tried to make a deal to do something about it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Could we get to know more?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: No idea. Maybe the invitation will show us the answer eventually?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You seem to be weirdly fixed on the Sweepers, by the way. What’s up with that?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Something about them smelled suspicious…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They do have an awful smell, I’ll give you that…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Take a sniff of those filthy bandages, and your appetite’s…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you insane?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sheesh, can’t even crack a joke…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, anyway, this is the first time our Miss Library Director let her intuition speak so much… I guess it won’t hurt to keep an eye on this case.

Place.PlaceName: Location: L Corp’s Nest - Residential Area

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello, Miss Lala… Here’s your Prescript.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: “To Lala. Put three needles in Lily’s birthday cake by noon tomorrow.”

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: By Lily, does it mean Mrs. Lily who’s living next door…? I did hear it’s her birthday tomorrow…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’m not sure myself…

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: …What if she bites one of those needles and gets hurt?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: ……You never know, she might luckily notice the needles before she eats them.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Or you could tell her in advance that there are needles in her cake.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Oh… Is it okay for me to spoil the Prescript to her?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: The Prescript didn’t say anything about it, so it should be alright…

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: It’s strange, though. I’ve been only getting weird Prescripts like this lately… Is there a meaning to this?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: If you don’t carry out the Prescripts, the Index won’t provide protection… You have a family, right?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I hope you can fulfill this one smoothly.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: …Okay.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello, Mister Lee Deok-gu. You’ve got a new Prescript.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: What now… What more am I supposed to do now?!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Sorry, sir. I sadly can’t do anything for you even if you cling to me.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Now… Take in deep breath, and read it out.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: …‘To Lee Deok-gu. Play rock paper scissors with the third person you meet and play rock. If you win, pull out 59 strands of their hair…’

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: ‘Then, apply seafood-cream pasta sauce with mealworms fed on styrofoam to it three times, and eat it with a fork.’

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Sick bastards… You’re telling me to eat that shit?

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: I had to make risotto out of sewer water and give it to Minji next door just a week ago… They ate it without asking, and ended up going to the ER!

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Fuck this!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’m sorry… All I do is deliver the Prescripts…

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Please… I’ll give you as much money as you want! Or let me get a different Prescript just this once, I beg you…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I’d love to change this, but… I don’t have the authority to do that.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …Everyone faces a test of faith in the Prescripts. I hope you can overcome this.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Messenger Yan! Long time no see~

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello, Proxy Gloria. Do you have business with Mister LaMarcus here, too?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Yep, I do! I got a Prescript, hehe.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello, Mister LaMarcus? Are you there? We’re here to talk~!

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Mmm~? This won’t do! Leave it to me, sweetie~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Aha~ There you are!

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: …Please… It was… It was a tiny issue…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Did this person not carry out his Prescript?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Nope! So a Prescript came down to me, telling me to smash Mister LaMarcus’s frontal lobe.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Usually, Proxies only receive Prescripts on the rare occasion… of someone else not carrying out their Prescript, Mister LaMarcus.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: …You’re shitting me. ‘Kill the painting you've drawn.’ …Does this make sense to you!!?

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Painting was everything in my life, and I smeared my own art with ink… stabbed them, tore them… Painted pictures of dead people in so many different ways… I did everything!!!

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Huh~? That’s a totes simple problem~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Just pick anyone from the streets, use them as a model for your painting, and then kill them. Isn’t that a no brainer?

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Th… This is… This isn’t my fault! It’s the Prescript being too vague…!

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It’s not the Prescript’s fault that you were too dumb to get it~

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: You sick fucks! I did all I could to live!

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: I relayed numbers to a guy called Riemann, I moved a unicorn plushie to a park, and I even found a way to see green from a white wall for Hye-in!

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: I’d been doing so good…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Too bad you couldn’t keep it up this time~

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: I understand that you tried. But…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Once we get a Prescript, we should carry it out, no exceptions~

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …I’m sorry.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Ahhhhhhh!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …Hello, Mister John. Here’s your Prescript.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: ‘To John. Stand on any three-way intersection at 3:38 tomorrow, look to the east, and wave seven times.’

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Is this really all I have to do to be protected by you guys? No need to pay money like with the other Syndicates?

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Yes… That’s the case. All you need to do is carry out each Prescript accordingly.

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: Sweet! The Index really is the best!

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: You don’t ask for backbreaking fees like the others do.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Will you please reconsider? Nothing is truly free in this City…

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: I just have to carry out the Prescripts that come to me from time to time, don’t I?

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: The Nest went under so suddenly… Dangerous gangs started prancing around the residential area…

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: And other Syndicates all wanted me to pay absurd amounts of money or sign these ridiculous contracts…

Dialog.Title: Nest Resident
Dialog.Content: The Index is the only one me and my family can count on!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …If you believe so. You’ll be safe as long as you follow the Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Maybe…

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Hello… Proxies. You have a new Prescript to carry out.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: New Prescripts, huh…

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We’ve been getting Prescripts a whole lot more often these days!

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Prescripts will be Prescripts. It’s not like you ever cared about how many Prescripts you got.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I have no doubts about Prescripts, no~ Though we might be seeing a lot of bloodshed with the Thumb and the Sweepers at this rate?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: I don’t have any blood left in my body to shed anyhow~

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: If war is what the Prescript requires, we shall gladly wage war.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It’s our role to act on behalf of the Prescript’s will.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: We will carry out the Prescripts we’ve received first.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: As Proxies, each of us will convey the content that Prescript Messenger Yan gave us to the Proselytes in our familia.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: …What are the Prescripts about this time, by the way?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Let’s see~ Mine is to extract the spinal cords of 37-year-old people in this Nest.

Dialog.Title: Index Messenger
Dialog.Content: Every 37-year-old in the Nest?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Dunno~? It’s up to Proxy Esther to clarify ambiguities in Prescripts, y’know~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: It does target all denizens of the Nest. Search for every single person of the specified age and take their spine.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: Our familia’s task is to exchange the left leg of the fourteenth person we come across today with the right leg of the twenty-sixth person we run into.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: They’re so out there~ It actually feels strange to get a straightforward Prescript for once, you see, Yan~?

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: ‘…Eliminate the Thumb. No time limits.’

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: This one needs no explanation.

Dialog.Title: Index Proxy
Dialog.Content: …I will send my Proselytes to the Library as my Prescript dictates.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh boy… The Index really is coming for us, huh.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It seems the ‘Prescripts’ are often vague and need clarification.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I haven’t seen ‘em myself, so I frankly have no idea how those instructions look. Dunno who makes the Prescripts, either.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s impossible that they could maintain such a massive Syndicate following orders that come out of nowhere.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s the scary part. Those Prescripts seem random, but they work out in their favor somehow.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And no one knows who’s responsible for making them?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I haven’t seen anyone that knows, at least.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Prescripts are long since appointed as a Star of the City.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I can hardly believe that so many are following such amphigory so blindly.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s pretty much everyone in the City. Like they said, people all just live according to the purpose of life given by someone or something else without thinking twice.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Heck, those who are still lost without a purpose would gladly take Prescripts.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Even if they require them to yield their own lives?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re willing to declare war against the Thumb because a Prescript said so. Life surely isn’t the biggest concern for them.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: But that’s only a conflict between Syndicates, not Wings. Can it really be called a war?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Ehey, ma’am~ You have no idea how big they really are!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: When the hundreds of Finger-affiliated Syndicates all clash at the same time, the scale and the aftermath is most certainly comparable to that of a war between Wings.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: This town’s gonna be noisy with those fanatics around for a while.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: The train has arrived.

Dialog.Title: WARP Corp.
Dialog.Content: It will be available at the terminal in ten minutes.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Quick, let’s get moving.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Let’s see what kind of mess it got into this time.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: I really hope it’s anything like the last time. All the passengers were sitting still in their seats, clasping their hands together.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: You said that’s an extremely uncommon occurrence though, right?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Yep. They usually do arts and crafts with each other’s organs and shit.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: You’ve probably seen the educational footage, but you’d better be prepared, newb.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: I don’t think I’ll ever want to take a WARP train in my life.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Even if they let you forget all about it?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: No thanks. Knowing what happens absolutely kills the deal for me.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
