Dialog.Content: Hey, we’re all ready. It’s time to start the cleanup.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Open up!

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Fresh meat, just follow the manual. Remember the procedures.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: This one’s pretty typical.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Eww… The stench is so strong even with my mask on, it feels like it’s physically stinging my nose.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Hello~ You’re still alive, right?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Hmm… “The flesh is spread thin in an attempt to maximize the surface area. The subject is determined to feel as much pain as possible…” This one would classify as a suicidal.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Ooh, you’re pretty good, aren’t ya? A lot of newbies can’t help but puke or faint on their first field job, even with the help of educational footage.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: ‘Cause she’s from District 23.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Can’t say I’ve seen worse, but I’m used to seeing this level of grotesque things.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Now, now. Cleanup agents, identify the genomes in your designated carriages and place the passengers back in their seats.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Gross… Look at that mushy eye still rolling around… I can never get used to this. I wonder how long I’ll be doing this work…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: You said cleanup agents go through a memory erasure procedure and get their retirement fund when they quit, right?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: You seriously buy that crap? You should know something’s up especially since you’re from the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: You mean that’s a lie?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: They’d probably drag you to some dark room and kill you without anyone knowing.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Whoops, don’t tell anyone that I said this. My employee review results weren’t too good this time around. You know I was just kidding, right?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Huhuhu. Maybe I’ll consider keeping quiet if you buy me dinner. How about some gopchang-jeongol!

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Gopchang? You eat beef tripe? Rose… I’m starting to get scared of this newbie…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: …Is that true?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Hm hm hmm~ Gotta do some work~ Work~ Sort out the genomes~ And I just gotta put them on the right seats, correct?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Yep~ Just put ‘em on their seats, and they’ll be restored, good as new.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Sen, Lesti. Stop your work immediately. We’re going back to the office.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Wha?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Passengers have gone missing?!

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Hey! Keep it down. We don’t want anyone else to hear that, dig?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: This room is in maximum security, anyway.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: It’s not just any passengers, the ones in First Class seats have disappeared.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: The higher ups are gonna have a headache over this, too.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: First Class passengers disappearing is already a significant risk, but we’ve also lost some time.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: The time quota wasn’t fulfilled.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: WARP Corp. has never had a siiingle incident ever since it became a Wing, hasn’t it? Gee, I wonder what went wrong now.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: The engineers are investigating it for now. Take a look at this first.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Oh~ This must be the camera that only records important moments based on the emotional flux of people nearby!

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: I saw it in an educational footage.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Ugh, what’s up with that? Did people merge into one at some point?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Those guys look like doctors? They’re stitching bodies together so precisely.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: I pity the cleanup agents who’ll have to tear them apart.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: That entity possessed extreme physical strength, sixteen of our agents were killed by that thing alone.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: “Love Town”… They made a town for themselves too, huh.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: That doctor-ish duo must’ve been the anchor of the town… The townsfolk are all crying since they’re gone.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: How did they get off the train, though?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Check this out. It’s footage of the First Class carriage.

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Who the hell are y— GAHHHHH!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Do you know who I am?! Brat! Do you?! I’m a board member of U Corp!!!

Dialog.Title: Passenger
Dialog.Content: Who sent you… Who’s behind this!!!

Dialog.Title: Puppeteer
Dialog.Content: Who could it be, I wonder? Heehee… Must be the invisible strings that are doing all this.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: He’s stitching the flesh of living people… And putting strings in them…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: The heck is that guy? Got any contact from Hana Association? Is that a Syndicate, or what?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: That seems to be the one called ‘The Puppeteer’. Looks like he has quite a reputation in the Backstreets.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: What’s his grade?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Urban Nightmare. But he just laid hands on VIPs, so he’ll be exalted to a Star of the City in no time.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: And here. The one next to him is ‘Blood-red Night’. She’s a former Star of the City that was shot down some time ago.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Wait, is it possible for a Star to come back after being shot down?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Hell if I know. Why did they have to take the train we’re in charge of and do all that?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Most importantly, check this part out.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: The First Class passengers… No, “puppets” as designated by Hana Association.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: You can see those puppets sign a piece of paper here, yeah?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Oh, they really are? They’re writing their names on a gorgeous-looking piece of paper.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: And they just disappeared?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Whoa, what. Ain’t that a real teleportation?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: This is the very same kind of paper they signed off on.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Um, are you… Actually gonna…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Rose! Please give us a break…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: We’re signing this paper as well. This is the so-called “invitation” from an Urban Nightmare dubbed ‘The Library’.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Sigh…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Sob, sob… I struggled and worked like a dog in District 23… And I barely made it into this Wing…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: It’s the orders from up top. No choice but to follow ‘em. We’ll bring a few other cleanup agents with us to the Library.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Dude, what if we refused this order…

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Then we’re fired.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Bwaaaahaaaaaa!!!

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So it really wasn’t a malfunction.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Those crooks at W Corp… They knew everything.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Gah, dammit… I took WARP trains a couple of times before…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Don’t you remember anything that happened inside?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nope, not at all. All I can remember is admiring the marvels of modern technology after getting off the train.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And look those employees. Following manuals, making jokes about it, taking care of flesh chunks so casually.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Lobotomy Corp. was no different. Still, it’s rather intriguing to see another Wing’s mortifying secrets with my own eyes.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I see that everyone is the same, after all. Doing detestable things simply because it’s their work…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They can be apathetic about it because the suffering inflicted on others is none of their business.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s gonna be sick if we made a book out of this.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Imagine if this knowledge leaks into the world. I bet no one will ever wanna use W Corp’s trains anymore, yeah?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Which would make W Corp. that much more desperate to retrieve it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I’d welcome that. I can learn even more about them that way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Upfront as always, our Miss Library Director.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: And I take pride in that.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: For real?!

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Yep. They made a whole ass kingdom on the train one time.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Appointed each other as kings, knights, nobles, and whatever.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: A town is nothing compared to that.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Treason and schemes were rampant, the kingdom fell into decline, and loyal knights made valiant efforts to save their failing country.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Wow~ What happened next?!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Enough chitchats, agents.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: Hey there. Have the… puppets been here recently?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You mean the puppets made from W Corp’s First Class passengers, correct?

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: …How much do you know, lady.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: They have, of course. And you may retrieve their books so that no one else would learn of the incident.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If you fail, however, other guests may obtain the books that hold the secrets of WARP trains.

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: W Corp. would be totally screwed, then?!

Dialog.Title: WARP Cleanup Agent
Dialog.Content: We’re going in right now.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: If this book does become available to the public, W Corp. might face closure like Lobotomy Corp. did.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Though it would collapse in an entirely different way.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …I know this is an odd time to ask, but about the plan that took place in Lobotomy Corporation, the one that made you go through countless repeats…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Was L Corp’s disintegration part of it, too?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: In a way. The finale of that plan was to share the enlightenment gained from that cycle with the people of the City, sacrificing L Corp. as a whole.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: L Corp’s insane suicide plan succeeded somehow, huh…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: No. The plan failed spectacularly, actually. I ruined it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: What? But, didn’t the ‘White Nights and Dark Days’ happen as a result of i—

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I never said the plan was a success, now did I? I only said it was over.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …What do you exactly mean by “ruining” it.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Remember what I said about my creator? How he birthed me on a whim, and renounced me when I didn’t meet his arbitrary expectations?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The sabotage was my modest little revenge on him for imprisoning me in the million-year cycle of reciting the same script over and over underground, and a small gift for myself.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I couldn’t bear to see his plan succeed with my two eyes.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That means… The Distortion might not have happened if the plan went through…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Perhaps?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: There’s no need for me to care so much about others in the City, no?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: …You’re right about that.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Now, friends… Don’t get too excited, you’re rushing it…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: My poor friend is about to faint from crying, see…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Thelma… Oh, Thelma… You pitiful friend…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You’d better hold your tears in, though.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: The real fun hasn’t even begun yet.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Hoh hoh hon. This spicy smoke from me wee pipe oughta dull your pain, eh?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Ain’t this one scaredy little fellow, Wang, me pal~

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Sure is, sure is. Hoh hoh hon. I still only flaked about, what, 1347 slices so far…

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Now let’s see ‘ere… Blue fella, how many slices did ye want again…?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Thelma may be a dear friend of mine, but breaking promises is a serious crime, so…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: How about ten thousand slices?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Alrighty, alrighty. Leave it ta me, chap.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Aw, buggeridoo~! Mi, you greedy ol’ lass!! Ye can’t just eat all of the slices off the plate!!!

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Crikey, yer gonna pop me eardrums! We’re eating ‘em anyways, so why not have some now, hm?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Now, now~ There’s still plenty more for all o’ us, so don’t fight over some bitty meat.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: I gotta try and flake enough to feed all o’ us full.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Thelma… Don’t give me such a look. You knew the terms of our deal.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You were handling all the tasks so well, you can’t just fail me in the end…

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Blue feller, looks like this feller has something ta’ say already… Do we pull the gag outta his mouth?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Sure, please do.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: Gasp… Guh… Huff, huff…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: Blue Reverb… You… crazy son of a bitch…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: Don’t be ridiculous… You’re the one who gave me an impossible task in the first place…!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Sigh… It was your choice to only employ Section 2 of the southern branch for this, Thelma.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You could’ve had Section 1 deal with some of them. Little Mister Prideful Thelma tried pulling a shabby scheme to get rid of Section 2 so he could keep his seat, and now he’s failed to keep up his promise with me.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: But you!!! You gave me the hint to use them!!!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I never said it was a must, though, now did I?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: All I asked from you was to take care of the things on the list within the period I set. And you agreed to it.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: …Cunning bastard… …If you kill me, the branch manager… Then Section 1 of my branch will be after you, and Shi HQ will too…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: Even Hana is going to make a move…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: So… Please…!

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: Please give me another chance…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Thelma… You just can’t bring yourself to say sorry for breaking our promise till the very end.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: It aches my heart to see it. Oh, and you don’t have to worry about me.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Remind me where we are, friends?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: It’s de Backstreets, aye. Of, err… District 23, issit?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Woh, really? Don’t this poor ol’ lad realize it’s nighttime?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Course he wouldn’t! His eyes are covered tighty-like!

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Aye, aye.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: …The Night in the Backstreets?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Bingo-bingo. No one will ever know where or how you died, and who killed you.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: You’ll just slowly melt away from the City… Right?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: I’m certain he will, Sir Argalia.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Kay then! Let’s proceed with it, friends.

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: …I’m sorry! I’m so sorry, sir!

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: I’m terribly sorry… Khn, hnn… I’m sorry for breaking our promise…

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: What do we doodily-do, Blue fella?

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Do we cut it short ‘ere?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Thelma…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: Yes! Argalia… It’s all my fault… I swear…

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: I swear! That I’ll never! Try to pull any cheap schemes!

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: And I’ll never break promises with you ever again…!

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Ah~ Thelma…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I’m about to shed a tear…

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: There’s no way I’d actually spare you for making a sincere apology.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: I knew you weren’t the brightest friend in the supposed shed, but I didn’t think you’d be this slow.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Still… I’ll take your apology to heart.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Now, now. Time to put yer gags back on, laddie. Say ah~

Dialog.Title: Shi S. Branch Manager
Dialog.Content: AAAAAAAAH!!!! YOU BITCH!! I HATE YOU SO MUCH!!!!

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Don’t make such a sad face, lad~ We all gotta have more smiles and laughter in our life.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: What’ll we do next, fella?

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: As soon as you’re done with him, head to the Library. I’ll leave the invitation here.

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: And take good care of Thelma. He was my old friend, all in all.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Hoh hon. You bet we will. Take care, laddie~

Dialog.Title: The Blue Reverberation
Dialog.Content: Now then, Eileen. Shall we go meet some other friends?

Dialog.Title: Church of Gears Leader
Dialog.Content: Of course, sir.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He’s totally won over the heart of the leader of the Church of Gears, huh…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Sigh… That absolute madman…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He’s a Fixer, and he’s got a Distortion and even the Smiling Faces on his leash…

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Being a Color must mean having immense power, is that right?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Mmhmm. Colors are exceptionally skilled Fixers even among Grade 1.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Hana Association assigns a unique color to each of ‘em.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Assigned a color…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: They’re the best Fixers in the City, basically.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Their pay is way up there, too.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I suppose ‘The Blue Reverberation’ was assigned the color blue.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Yep. Just like how ‘The Red Mist’ was assigned the color red.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Is he as strong as the Red Mist?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Well, in terms of sheer power, the Red Mist in her prime is probably above him.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: But, there’s a whole lot of fields of Fixer activity, and the situations can differ for each case, so it’s hard to make a fair one-on-one comparison.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: For example, the Red Mist liked to work alone, but the Blue Reverb is leading a Urban Nightmare-class Syndicate as you can see there.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Could we get the Blue Reverberation’s book if we ever happen to need it?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Maybe, if we tried by any means. The City would be much better off without that maniac, too.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Hoho, would ye look at that~ This place sure is a whole ‘nother world~

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Don’t get lost in it now, lad! Ya got to keep on yer toes in a tiger’s den.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Huff~ ‘s about time the director showed up?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Greetings, dear guests.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Nice to meet ya, lassie~

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Say, you have the book of an ol’ pal named Yujin here, eh?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: We do indeed.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Woh, really? Guess there really is. Blue fella really is a scary one.

Dialog.Title: Smiling Faces
Dialog.Content: Sure is, sure is. Everything’s goin’ as he says.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …May you find your book in this place.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Just what could that Blue Sicko be looking for so badly…?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Any guesses?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: There’s just way too many off the top of my head.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That crazed pervert can and will go far beyond anyone’s expectations.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: This is… the 8 o’Clock Circus!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: We bring the bestest of the smells to City people who have lost their flower stalks.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: What…? The 8 o’Clock… Circus?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Don’t tell me, do you perhaps not know what a circus is?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Well, no matter! Venturing into unknown tastes always comes with a stomachache, after all!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: We are the circus whose singular purpose is to spread the flower seeds of the people.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: If ten people could become clowns and blow up one thousand flowers… Oh, just imagine how wonderfully joyous this world would be!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: B—Bullshit… This is…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Ugh… These are… …Oh, what the…! These… These are all… people…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: My oh my oh my! Our new clown friend still seems to be a shy one!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Maybe I should introduce you to the rest of our troupe first.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Alright, Ms. Mermaid and Mr. Knife? Let’s share some of our salts with him!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Stop, stop it!!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh dear, oh my… Looks like Ms. Mermaid didn’t have enough practice with her scaly mane, you lackadaisical girl… Your voice is too small! Or are you feeling timid all of a sudden? Whatever the case!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: You maniacs… This is all abnormal…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Who gets to decide what’s normal and what’s abnormal, now?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: If everyone wears a hat weaved from fancy rats on their head… Should that be considered normal?!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Haha! Hahahah!!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: You won’t ever get to be considered normal, that’s for sure…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Harumph, you’re such a rude fellow, aren’t you!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: The 8 o’Clock Circus…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Now I remember. You’re the ones who kept Wedge Office busy… And everyone at Dawn Office died in the Library because they couldn’t help.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …If it weren’t for small fries like you, maybe my master and seonbae would’ve been safe and sound.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Talk about a coincidence…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: You… You’re actually starting to give a similar stink as mine!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: But the stench isn’t strong enough just yet; you’re still too fragrant!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shut up! I’ll slay you… here and now…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Hm… Still smells good, way too good…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: But, what if we mixed that fragrance with a filthy smell to create a new, boggy scent!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Okay, alright. Let’s perform with me, shall we!
Young Philip.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: …Master? Seonbae?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: What the… What are you…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: A big hand for the three clowns who will lead the show~ Clappity clap~

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I… What the hell have you done…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Whoopsie daisy, you’re making such a humpy face!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Surprise is a stimulant, one that leads to laughter and entertainment!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: A true flower only blooms after you have faced your biggest inner abscess and squeezed all the pus out of it!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: You can’t laugh to your heart’s content until you’ve swallowed the fragrant pus of sadness whole, you know?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: That’s where I would like to help you!
Philip… I’m sorry I couldn’t answer what you asked back then.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Oh, what an unexpected turn of events?!
I…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: B-But, master already has a wife and children…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Hahaha! Talk about childish. This is such a typical telenovela we have here!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shut up… You, don’t you dare insult my two mentors with these false illusions!!!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Pardon? I would never.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Isn’t what you’re seeing right now… the putrid scent that you believed to be true in your heart so blindly and obviously?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Whether it’s true doesn’t matter! You were so certain about it, too. I don’t get why you could be trying to denounce your own claims now!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: You’re pausing it at just the right moment like it’s a rerun you’ve watched over and over… There’s got to be a reason.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shut up, shut the hell up…!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: “Did you know? The reason I shunned you, and the topic he wanted to discuss with you.”

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: No… This has to be a dream… That—That pesky damn clown…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: “That’s enough, Philip. We were simply…”

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: They’re all the same… You all toyed with me!
…Young Philip.
What efforts have you actually made to advance your goals?
You must’ve spent most of your energy fabricating all sorts of filthy and uncouth delusions about us simply because Yuna was reluctant to answer your question. Am I wrong here?
Do you think you have any right to blame us?

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Stop, stop it… I…!
How pathetic. You ran away alone, and now you’re playing the victim.
It was your incompetence, and you didn’t even try to fix it… All you were doing was shamelessly looking for excuses.
You ran off without us telling yourself that it’s to save us, and now you’re blaming us for it.
You’re believing whatever you want to believe. Because it makes you feel better. Isn’t that true?
After all, it’s much easier to pretend that you’re thinking of others before yourself, rather than accept who you really are.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: You both… abandoned me… died like that.
You still haven’t realized. It was foolish of me to put my trust in you…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Shut up! Why do you show up now and haunt me!!!

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: You keep bothering me till the end… Just leave me alone now!

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: …It would appear that you require assistance.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Not feeling quite talkative, are you? Well, it’s fine. We have all the time in the world, so let us open up inch by inch.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: When a person feels victimized or vexed, someone has to reach out to them and give them a helping hand.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: I shall be that someone for you. That is what I am here for.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Now, hold my hand… Alright, I will kindly extend my arm this far for you.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: Are you… going to make my wish come true?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: If you utter your wishes, I will give you what you need to make them come true. Does this offer still sound unsatisfactory?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: I can grant you strength to avenge yourself on that prankster who inflicted much suffering upon you, or I can provide you with powerful weaponry to save the two people you cherish.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I… don’t want to hear anything.

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I don’t want to see anything… or speak anything…

Dialog.Title: Ex-Dawn Fixer
Dialog.Content: I’m tired of it all. Right now, all I want is to just… cry out loud.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: But of course. I can help you with that.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Pay close attention to her voice…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: What’s this now?! You started exuding the same stink as mine?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Aren’t you a man of talent! You never told me you could make such vibrant expressions~!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: And… oh. Could you be another new jester to visit us? You’re looking splendid!

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: …Yes, hello. My name is Pluto.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: You’ve come at just the right time! The three of us could make for a wonderful show~

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Now, may I ask you a single question?

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Was the relationship between the three people you just showed on the stage actual truth?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Pft, how lame! Why would anyone care about that at this point?!

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: What matters the most is that the show gave our audience fun and entertainment, isn’t it?!

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Creating illusions from one’s distorted desires, is it… I can see that this place amplifies people’s desires to the maximum.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Sniff, sniff… You’re also a rather smelly individual…

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Ooh, did you also hear her voice?

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: …Nevermind that! Nooow, now! The audience is waiting, so please join me in the rest of the show!

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: I’m afraid the circus must come to an end as of today.

Dialog.Title: Ringmaster
Dialog.Content: Golly, what are you even talking about now?!

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: Philip, here is an invitation for you. Move onward.

Dialog.Title: Yesterday’s Promise
Dialog.Content: And Oswald, I invite you to a far grander stage where we can hold the greatest show you could imagine.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That’s one miserable guy, I gotta say.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Are you sympathizing with him after all this time? You called him selfish and dangerous the last time we saw him.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I mean, that’s… I’m not really showing sympathy, if I had to explain…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I still think Philip is hopeless personality-wise, but the circumstances he’s getting into don’t seem to be helping his emotions at all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I know I said tragedies like that are common, but he probably still feels cornered, you know what I mean?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He seemed pretty close to overcoming that, but then that clown named Oswald broke his will again.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So it’s hard for me to just laugh. I don’t really enjoy watching others rolling in a pit of misery like it’s some kind of entertainment show.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Oh, not trying to be sentimental, of course. That’s that, and this is this.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: …I see what you mean. It was his own failure to overcome it, after all.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That aside, I wonder how he ended up looking like this.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: The surge of emotions crossed the line of E.G.O, which caused him to undergo the so-called Distortion phenomenon… Thus turning him into an Abnormality.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: So that’s how a Distortion is made, huh… I could still use some more explanation, though.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That looked kinda similar to how people are turned into books here in the Library?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It’s similar to the process of Abnormalities coming into existence as well. That one still seems unstable, however.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Distorted desires and emotions… What do you think the stage will show you?

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: It’s gonna be my wife, one-hundred percent.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: You get the picture. The woman who I couldn’t protect walks up to me, I cry in despair, et cetera.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: You’re quite honest about it.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I got nothing to lose, so there’s no point in lying.
Where is this?
Who talked shit about me just now?!

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Interesting. There’s three of them.
You have a pretty voice, eh, lady?
What? You don’t even wanna deal with me ‘cause I look like a kid?
Did that lady with a pretty voice just stare us down or something?
Yeah, she did. Talk about a weird place.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: How uncouth. Well, guests are guests, I suppose.
What now, what’s up with this noise?
I bet that one’s making all kinds of insults at me.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: See that door behind me? You’ll go through there.
Door…? Yeah, doors are good… Where’s that door at, though?
She’s pointing at something. Is she telling us to fuck off over there?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Make haste and get in. I don’t feel like getting caught in your annoying powers.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And then one of ‘em separated itself from the big guy and got away while it was turning into a book…

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: He was still his cowardly self deep inside. Nothing about him really changed.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It must have been the Library’s will to let this happen.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: The Library’s will, huh… It sure does work in mysterious ways.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: I know how ugly the human mind can be, but that was just nastily explicit.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: Perhaps everyone has such vulgarity deep inside their minds, covered up in layers of facade.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: And the Distortion unwraps all that to expose their true feelings?

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: I cannot say for sure if it’s the pure expression of their unadulterated feelings. I’m still uncertain whether it’s the Distortion unveiling the emotions or the emotions being distorted as they are revealed.

Dialog.Title: Library Director
Dialog.Content: It should reveal their most honest side nonetheless, having all their facades taken off.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: That ought to feel like being naked, huh.

Dialog.Title: Servant
Dialog.Content: Nothing’s as awkward and embarrassing as the moments right after letting out all your honest feelings.
